Comments: Name of the project underwhich the experiment was carried out
Encripted vessel identifier. ID encrypted so that no-one can map the ID to the real vessel
Identifier of the trip for a given project and vessel
Identifier of the fishing operation for a given trip
Identify the subgear (for twin protocol) or the gear (for paired/unpaired protocol): STD for Standard gear or TEST for experimental gear
Free tag used to associate station in case of "paired" protocols
Haul sarting date. "YYYY-MM-DD" (ISO 8601) in UTC
Haul starting time. "HH:MM:SS" (ISO 8601) in UTC
minutes
I = Invalid ou V = Valid. Haul validity according to protocol criteria. If reported, invalid operations are removed.
ICES statistical rectangle
Latitude in decimal degrees of the shooting position
Latitude in decimal degrees of the hauling position
Longitude in decimal degrees of the shooting position
Longitude in decimal degrees of the hauling position
Water depth in metres
"YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" (ISO 8601) in UTC
"YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" (ISO 8601)
Haul deployed during day or night time
Gear speed in knots
Gear Depth in metres
Sea state from Douglas Scale
Wind force from Beaufort Scale
N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W, NW
Sediment type of fishing ground
Identify the side of the subgear (e.g. Portside/Starboard for OTT).
